info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:33AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 533 AM MST /633 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Horseshoe Bend, or 7 miles west of Page, moving northeast at 5 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Page, Horseshoe Bend, Glen Canyon Dam, Wahweap, Marble Canyon, Marble Canyon Airport, Page Municipal Airport, Trapeze Cove, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lees Ferry, Golliard Park, Vermilion Cliffs National Monument and Lake Powell.
This includes the following slot canyons... Cathedral Wash near Marble Canyon and Stateline Wash.
This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 544 and 556. the Colorado River between river miles 0 and 5. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 536 and 538. State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Lee's Ferry Campground, Lees Ferry Campground, Wahweap Campground, Paria Beach Camp Site, Opposite Cathedral Camp Site, Cathedral Wash Camp Site, Ropes Trail Camp Site, Ferry Swale Camp Site, Twin Stripes Camp Site and Lees Ferry Camp Site.
info.instruction: Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN COCONINO COUNTY, INCLUDING LEES FERRY AND PAGE UNTIL 615 AM MST /715 AM MDT/

area.areaDesc: Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
